entry.title: CME Group 'Looking At' Offering Solana, Cardano Futures
entry.summary: CME Group has been "looking at" offering Solana and Cardano futures contracts, an executive said at a conference in London.

entry.title: Senator Lummis Defends Owning Bitcoin as a Policymaker
entry.summary: "Well, I own cows too, and cows are commodities. Bitcoin is a commodity," she said in an interview on "Meet the Press Reports."

entry.title: Do Your Own Research: Crypto Fact and Fiction on April Fools' Day
entry.summary: A Bitcoin white paper monument, sleep to earn, and a stablecoin merger were all jokes. And within crypto, they're also all plausible.

entry.title: Investment Bank Citi Is Bullish on the Metaverse, Predicts $13 Trillion Economy
entry.summary: But the investment bank thinks the tech still has a long way to go.

entry.title: SEC Denies Bitcoin ETF From Cathie Wood’s ARK Invest
entry.summary: The SEC has denied an application from ARKInvest and 21Shares to create a Bitcoin spot ETF, citing concerns about lack of oversight.

entry.title: Twitch Co-Founder’s Solana Gaming NFT Platform Fractal Raises $35M
entry.summary: Fractal’s seed round includes funding from Andreessen Horowitz, Solana Ventures, Coinbase, Animoca, Paradigm, and more.

entry.title: US Companies Must Disclose Customer Crypto Holdings, Says SEC
entry.summary: The SEC will require companies holding users crypto to account for those assets, clearly disclosing their nature and amount.

entry.title: OpenSea Enables NFT Purchases With Credit Cards, Apple Pay
entry.summary: You'll no longer need any crypto to buy an NFT on OpenSea—a move that could bring in more newcomers to the NFT space.

entry.title: Binance Hires Senior Microsoft Exec as CTO
entry.summary: Binance announced it has poached senior executives from Microsoft and travel giant Agoda.

entry.title: 9 Top Tips For Filing Your Crypto Taxes in 2022
entry.summary: With the tax deadline looming, it’s past time to get your paperwork in order. Here’s how to make the process of filing your crypto taxes simple.

entry.title: Regulators May Decide Greenidge’s Bitcoin Mining Fate in June
entry.summary: New York regulators will make a final decision on controversial Bitcoin mining firm Greenidge Generation’s permit this summer.

entry.title: ApeCoin Drops 8% After Bored Ape Yacht Club Discord Suffers Phishing Scam
entry.summary: The token behind the Bored Ape Yacht Club NFT collection has plunged overnight after the project’s Discord channel suffered a phishing scam.

entry.title: Bitcoin Briefly Dips Below $45,000 as EU Cracks Down on Crypto
entry.summary: Leading cryptocurrencies in Bitcoin and Ethereum both dropped points this morning as lawmakers in Europe take aim at crypto wallets.

entry.title: Netflix's 'Trust No One': Who Was QuadrigaCX CEO Gerald Cotten?
entry.summary: The latest true crime documentary from Netflix digs into the saga of defunct crypto exchange QuadrigaCX—and its mysterious founder.

entry.title: Proposed Bill Would Require Stablecoins to Be Backed by Dollars, Government Securities
entry.summary: The Stablecoin Transparency Act was introduced by Rep. Trey Hollingsworth and Sen. Bill Hagerty.

entry.title: Nike Wants to 'Destroy' Unauthorized NFTs—How Will That Work?
entry.summary: Nike is asking a court to destroy something that pretty much can't be destroyed.

entry.title: USDC Reserves Will Be Custodied With BNY Mellon, Says Circle
entry.summary: USDC stablecoin issuer Circle, valued at $9 billion, chooses BNY Mellon as primary custodian for its reserves.

entry.title: EU Parliament Votes to Impose KYC on Private Crypto Wallets
entry.summary: European Union lawmakers have voted to crack down on so-called unhosted cryptocurrency wallets.

entry.title: Axie Infinity Delays Ethereum NFT Game Upgrade After $622M Hack
entry.summary: The long-awaited Axie Infinity: Origin will launch a week late after the massive Ronin theft disclosed on Tuesday.

entry.title: #DecryptLIVE: Crypto, Taxes, and You
entry.summary: Tax Day is coming, and the crypto world is paying attention. Decrypt's Jeff Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Adriana Hamacher discuss what people and businesses need to know about crypto and taxes with special guest Nicholas Mowbray of Baker Hostetler.

entry.title: Bitcoin Exchange Blockchain.com Allowing NFT Usernames for Its 82 Million Wallets
entry.summary: Blockchain.com is integrating with Unstoppable Domains so wallet users can skip the alphanumeric addresses in favor of NFT usernames.

entry.title: Bitcoin Miner CleanSpark to Add 500 MW of Mining Power, Expand to Texas
entry.summary: Nevada-based Bitcoin miner CleanSpark has just inked a new deal to increase the firm's mining power and expand into the Lone Star state.

entry.title: Chiliz Plots Sports, Entertainment Crypto Ecosystem With 2.0 Chain
entry.summary: The Socios fan token creator is inviting brands to build alongside it on Chiliz Chain 2.0, which launches its testnet today.

entry.title: Game Developer Faces User Backlash Following FTX Acquisition
entry.summary: Players of Storybook Brawl are up in arms against FTX’s purchase of the free-to-play game’s developer, Good Luck Games.

entry.title: Metaverse Cryptocurrencies Enjoy Bullish Week Despite Axie Infinity's Ronin Hack
entry.summary: Gaming and NFT cryptos including Enjin and The Sandbox have risen over the week, despite a $552 million hack of Axie Infinity's Ronin sidechain.

entry.title: How the SEC Proposal to Change One Definition Could 'Kill' DeFi
entry.summary: The agency wants to expand the definition of "dealer."

entry.title: Solana Surges as NFT Trading Rises 80% Following OpenSea Reveal
entry.summary: NFT trading volume on Solana has pumped by 80% over the past day, and the price of SOL appears to be benefiting from increased interest.

entry.title: LayerZero Raises $135M From Andreessen, FTX, Sequoia to Build Out 'Omnichain' Protocol
entry.summary: The company is now valued at $1 billion.

entry.title: What Is Axie Infinity? The Play-to-Earn NFT Game Taking Crypto by Storm
entry.summary: Buy, battle, breed adorable monsters… and profit? That’s the hook behind Axie Infinity, the hottest crypto game on the market right now.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 6: Ditching Big Banks for Bitcoin With Caitlin Long
entry.summary: Caitlin Long spent nearly two decades at big banks Credit Suisse and Morgan Stanley before she went all in on Bitcoin. Now her company Custodia is seeking to offer banking services to crypto companies long shut out by the big banks. She talks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about identifying as a Bitcoin maximalist, crypto regulation in DC, and Web3 culture.

entry.title: Move Over Bored Apes: Rising Ethereum NFT Project Azuki Notches First $1M Sale
entry.summary: Azuki is one of the biggest new NFT projects of 2022, and it set a collection record with a $1.42 million sale last night.

entry.title: Helium Crypto Wireless Network Founders Raise $200M, Rebrand to Nova Labs
entry.summary: Andreessen Horowitz, Seven Seven Six, Goodyear Ventures, Deutsche Telekom, and others are backing the latest crypto unicorn.

entry.title: 12 Biggest DeFi Hacks and Heists
entry.summary: There's a lot of money flowing into DeFi. And thanks to hacks and exploits, there's sometimes a lot of money flowing out, too.

entry.title: Samsung Taps Nifty Gateway to Create Smart TV NFT Platform
entry.summary: Nifty Gateway’s marketplace will appear on Samsung’s new premium TVs, letting owners view and buy NFTs from the couch.

entry.title: Axie Infinity Tokens AXS, SLP Reeling After $622M Ronin Hack
entry.summary: The in-game tokens powering the popular play-to-earn crypto game Axie Infinity have continued to tumble following yesterday’s hack.

entry.title: Lionel Messi Signs Multi-Year Deal to Promote 'Fan Token' Firm Socios
entry.summary: Fan token platform Socios announced that soccer legend Lionel Messi has signed a new deal to promote the crypto firm for the next three years.

entry.title: DeFi Blue Chip Aave Mounts 30% Rise
entry.summary: The native token behind DeFi’s popular money market Aave has risen more than 30% over the past 24 hours amid a flurry of new developments.

entry.title: Web Browser Opera Adds Support for Bitcoin, Polygon, Solana
entry.summary: Opera is now supporting eight new blockchains, including the Bitcoin network, Ethereum scaler Polygon, and Solana.

entry.title: Robinhood Crypto Lead Christine Brown Leaving to Start Crypto Venture
entry.summary: Brown—who's overseen efforts to release a self-hosted wallet—says she'll "be staying in the crypto space."

entry.title: What are Governance Tokens? How Token Owners Shape a DAO's Direction
entry.summary: How are decisions made for billion-dollar protocols like Uniswap, Maker, and PancakeSwap? The answer, in part, is through governance tokens.

entry.title: Batman NFTs Coming to Ethereum via Palm With Planned Metaverse Perks
entry.summary: The 200,000 Bat Cowl NFTs will draw from Batman’s comic book history and provide various benefits.

entry.title: Ripple Co-Founder Chris Larsen Blasted as 'Judas' After Proposal to Change Bitcoin
entry.summary: The reactions to a campaign by Ripple's co-founder to change Bitcoin's code have been predictable—and often ferocious.

entry.title: Crypto on the Campaign Trail: Matt West, Matthew Diemer, Tyler Lindholm at Camp Ethereal 2022
entry.summary: Politicians are embracing crypto on both sides of the aisle. Matt West, running for congress in Oregon, Matthew Diemer, running for congress in Ohio, and former Wyoming Rep. Tyler Lindholm discussed crypto and politics on a panel with Decrypt's Jeff Roberts at Camp Ethereal in Wyoming. As Diemer pointed out, "We have a conservative Republican, a progressive Democrat, and a moderate Democrat on the same stage, unified by crypto and the idea of making sensible regulation."

entry.title: Crypto Taxes Got You Down? Software Can Help
entry.summary: Tax season is upon us, and crypto investors have questions. Tony Dhanjal, Head of Tax at crypto tax software service Koinly, shares tips in this sponsored segment.

entry.title: Pastel Network's Georgiades: How to Protect Your NFTs
entry.summary: Anthony Georgiades, co-founder of Pastel Network, talks to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward at Camp Ethereal 2022 about NFT security and the importance of protecting your digital artwork.

entry.title: Andrew Yang on Crypto Regulation in DC: 'This Train Is Coming. What's the Cargo?'
entry.summary: Andrew Yang, the former presidential and NYC mayoral candidate, talked crypto regulation in DC on Decrypt's gm podcast with Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts. Yang says the days of little or no crypto regulation in DC are "very very quickly coming to end" and that the question now is what the new rules will look like.

entry.title: Gitcoin's Scott Moore Talks Ukraine Fundraising Grant
entry.summary: Gitcoin co-founder Scott Moore tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson all about Gitcoin's GR13 grant, which is raising money for Ukraine and has matching participation from a range of Web3 names like OpenSea, OlympusDAO, NounsDAO, Polygon, Algorand, and more.

entry.title: The Importance of Layer 2: ConsenSys, Nomad, and LayrLabs at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: Robert Drost, Head of R&D at ConsenSys, talks Layer 2s and building atop Ethereum with James Prestwich of Nomad and Sreeram Kannan of LayrLabs at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming.

entry.title: ShapeShift, BeetsDAO Talk DAO Creation and Governance at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: Jordan Garbis, co-founder of BeetsDAO, and Kent Barton, who does tokenomics at ShapeShift DAO, talk to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming about how to start a DAO, the hurdles with growing them, how to handle tokenomics and reward structure, and how to approach bad behavior by DAO members. At the end, they also took questions from the audience.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 5: Andrew Yang Wants You to Join His DAO
entry.summary: The former presidential candidate and NYC mayoral candidate has launched Lobby3, a DC lobbying DAO. He talks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about his crypto journey, the potential of DAOs, and the need to blend a Web3 approach with "the old-fashioned way" to spur change in DC.

entry.title: Edward Snowden Talks Governments and Crypto, CBDCs, and Ethereum vs Bitcoin at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: Edward Snowden gives an extensive interview to Marta Belcher of Filecoin Foundation for Camp Ethereal 2022, taped on February 27. He talks about how governments view crypto as "an evolving threat," how crypto "transforms power relationships," why he thinks Ethereum "suffers from the same privacy problems as Bitcoin," and why he views central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) as "crypto-fascist currencies."

entry.title: Musician Dillon Francis on Ethereum vs Solana for NFTs
entry.summary: Musician and DJ Dillon Francis and Big Night Entertainment managing partner Tim Bonito tell Decrypt's Kate Irwin about their deal for a Boston nightclub residency and record collaboration with DJ duo ESCAPΞPLAN, and give their takes on Ethereum vs Solana for buying and trading NFTs.

entry.title: Musician Dillon Francis: Why I'm Getting Into NFTs
entry.summary: Musician and DJ Dillon Francis tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin what drew him to NFTs, and heaps a lot of praise on DJ 3LAU for pioneering in the space and prompting more artists to get in.

entry.title: Joe Lubin Talks Ethereum 2.0, NFTs, and DAOs at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: ConsenSys CEO Joe Lubin talked about Ethereum 2.0 timing and impact, the power of DAOs, and gave his honest take on NFTs, Solana, Polygon, and Biden's crypto executive order in an extensive fireside chat with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming.

entry.title: Crypto and Effective Altruism: Sam Bankman-Fried Interviews Peter Singer at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried sits down for a conversation with one of his heroes, the moral philosopher and Princeton University professor Peter Singer, exclusively for Camp Ethereal 2022, powered by Decrypt. They talk animal rights, climate change, effective giving, Bitcoin's energy use, and how crypto is helping Ukraine.

entry.title: #DecryptLIVE: Biden's Executive Order & Ethereal 2022
entry.summary: Decrypt's Dan Roberts and Decrypt Daily podcast host Matthew Diemer chat live in Wyoming about the crypto executive order and other insights from Camp Ethereal 2022.

entry.title: Decrypting the Week 10: Ukraine Welcomes Crypto
entry.summary: As Russia’s invasion of Ukraine continues, Ukraine has raised more than $50 million in crypto donations—in Bitcoin, Ethereum, Polkadot, and even Dogecoin. Decrypt’s Dan Roberts, Scott Chipolina, and Kate Irwin, joined by special guest Izabella Kaminska of The Blind Spot, discuss the biggest story in the world right now.

entry.title: Muneeb Ali: It's 'Easy to Make Fun' of NFTs, But They Are Here to Stay
entry.summary: On Episode 4 of Decrypt's gm podcast, Muneeb Ali of Stacks gave Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts his take on why NFTs are so triggering to people. He understands why they're easy to make fun of or "dismiss as a toy," but expects them to be used for a whole range of important business purposes in the future.
